intro: Wikstroemia dolichantha, commonly known as the Hawaiian hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to the island of Hawaii. It belongs to the Melastomataceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 5 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and often have a hairy texture, while its fruits are capsule-like and contain numerous small seeds. Wikstroemia dolichantha is adapted to the humid, tropical climate of Hawaii and plays a role in the local ecosystem.
